Rampling said she has a "tremendous inner resilience" which has helped her through times of "doubt and darkness" Wednesday 1 March 2017 11:31 GMT Click to followES Entertainment Not worrying: Charlotte Rampling said she does not fear growing old Serge Leblon courtesy of Harpers Bazaar 
Charlotte Rampling says getting older doesn’t worry her — and that “inner resilience” has kept her going. 
The actress, 71, who in 2016 received her first Oscar nomination for her role in the drama 45 Years, said: “I’m into my seventies and it’s a good feeling. 
“Every time you hit a decade, as long as you don’t resist it or panic, something major happens. There’s always something else around the corner.” 
Her latest film an adaptation of Julian Barnes’s novel The Sense Of An Ending. She was speaking as she took part in a shoot for Harper’s Bazaar, marking 50 years since her first with the magazine. That shoot, in 1967, took place weeks after the suicide of her sister aged 23. Throw back: Charlotte Rampling profiled in the magazine in 1967 (Harpers Bazaar) 
Rampling said: “Looking back at it [the first shoot], I feel hopeful. I think: a lot of stuff is going to hit that girl but she’s got a great attitude. 
“My attitude is what has saved me throughout my life. I’m optimistic, I believe that there will be light on the horizon.” Through the years: Charlotte Rampling on the cover of the April issue of Harper’s Bazaar (Serge Leblon courtesy of Harpers Bazaar) 
The actress, whose father Godfrey was an Olympic sprinter and Army officer, lost her partner to illness in 2015. She said: “I’ve been through wrenching depression but I’ve somehow always known I’ll come out the other side. Strong: Charlotte Rampling said her “inner resilience” has kept her going (Serge Leblon courtesy of Harpers Bazaar) 
“I’m strong, like my father, and I have a tremendous inner resilience, which has helped me through times of doubt and darkness. Life will go on, and I’ll feel again, and love again.” Read more
